projects.name: Universal Finance Manager
projects.description: Android application that provides comprehensive tracking and budgeting of personal finance. Stores user data in a local Room database and utilizes Dagger dependency injection. Made in an Agile/Scrum development cycle. In a 5-man dev team, I acted as Creative Director/Leader, and as a primary developer.

projects.name: Accountabillibuddy
projects.description: Desktop application that predicts the profitability of stock market investments. Stock market data is fetched from the Yahoo! Finance API via a third-party API. User data is stored in a PostgreSQL database hosted on AWS's Relational Database Service. My roles were full-stack development, technical writing, and graphic design.

projects.name: MEVN Real-Time Chat
projects.description: WIP. Real-time cross-browser chat application. Single-page application developed leveraging the MEVN stack and Socket.io. Paramount learning experience. Solidified my foundation with a wide variety of JavaScript frameworks and web development technologies.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: This website! Intended to be lightweight and simple to use. Aside from extremely minimal styling from Bootstrap, no other frameworks were used. WIP, I plan to use React.js to pass content to the view dynamically to ease maintenance and blogging updates.

projects.name: Unity 3D Platformer
projects.description: A simple 3D environment which emulates 2D platforming. The player controls a ball to collect coins scattered throughout the level. Allowed me to experiment with 3D physics progamming, lighting, texturing, and sound effects.

projects.name: Unity 2D Platformer
projects.description: A purely 2D platforming environment. WIP as I expand its features into a fully-fledged video game. Currently uses placeholder assets from Unity Asset Store and existing video games. Gave me a taste of sprite animation, background parallaxing, respawning, and shooting.

projects.name: NavMesh Tutorial
projects.description: Created by following the steps of Brackey's NavMesh Tutorial. Features an agent that automatically avoids obstacles (both static and dynamic) in a 3D space using Unity's inbuilt NavMesh components. By clicking at locations on the map, the agent calculates the best unobstructed path and moves there.

projects.name: TensorFlow Image Classifier
projects.description: Inspired by the TensorFlow for Poets Codelab by Google Developers. Trained the neural network using the Inception V3 Architecture on a repository of rabbit images. By manipulating training parameters, the model achieved an accuracy of up to 99% in distinguishing between four rabbit breeds as well as pictures of unknown objects.

projects.name: Swing Breakout Game
projects.description: Break-Out style video game with a twist! This time there's two projectiles, each with their own physics, balanced on a swing. Letting either projectile fall decrements the lives counter. This was made to practice OOP and test the limits of Java's Swing library. Yes, the 'Swing' is a double entendre.
